Dialogue: Black snake is evil, black snake is all I see.Black snake is evil, black snake is all I see.Woke up this mornin', black snake moved in on me.

Dialogue: I bet you have loyal customers.

Dialogue: You liked what I brung ya?

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: Been eatin' like a princess all week. Even got enough for us to take a picnic under the gazebo.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: That'd be nice.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: I put on the lotion you got me. Can you smell it?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: That's nice, too.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: sandy
Dialogue: What happened to your face?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Got in a little accident.

Speaker: sandy
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Since you workin' on the square now, maybe we could get some coffee in the morning, if you want.

Speaker: sandy
Dialogue: You need money again?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: No. That's not why...  Why we always gotta do this? I mean, you and me been at each other as far back as I can remember. Wasn't no love between us. And I'm your daughter. I'm the only family you got.

Speaker: sandy
Dialogue: You never needed nobody. Always made that clear to me.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Yeah. I know I did. But...  I'm tryin' to be dif'rent. I'm tryin' to... get some peace, you know?

Speaker: sandy
Dialogue: I'm workin' here, Rae. Can you see that?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I just wanted some make-up.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I just think you should'a kept him off me, that's all.

Speaker: sandy
Dialogue: The hell are you talkin' about?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Now see? Don't do that. I'll go along with all you say about me. But that... you can't pretend no more on that. Cuz I was just a kid, Momma.  And you let him do it. Some big nobody in your life... and you let him do as he wanted... with the only SOMEBODY you had.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to shout...

Speaker: sandy
Dialogue: All my life I been puttin' out your fires, with you givin' out your snatch to every waggin' dick in this town. And you gonna lay the blame at my feet? Well, I ain't gonna take that.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: But... Momma... just tell me... not gonna be mad... we can just talk about it... Be eye to eye on this... You don't even got to say you're sorry... Just say how you knew...

Speaker: sandy
Dialogue: Only thing I'm sorry for is listenin' to my parents and having you instead of doin' what I should'a done.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: ...tell me you don't know... goddamn LIAR!

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: SAY IT! JUST FUCKING SAY IT!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Rae! Rae! What are you doin'?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: GET OFF ME! GET OFF ME! GET... HIM...OFF!

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: I's thinkin' about singing in the choir.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: At church?

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: Mm-hm. I don't know if I got a good voice or not but... practice is only on Mondays and Wednesdays, so...

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: You gonna sing me somethin'?

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: When? Now? Oh. No.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Come on, just a little somethin'. Right here. Go'on now, don't be shy.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: There is a balm in Gilead to make the wounded whole.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: So. You think I should be in the choir?

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: What? What is it?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: RAE? GAL? YOU HEARIN' MY VOICE?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I'll take you home now.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: This your cousin?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Move, son.  Goddammit, kid, get outta my way!

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: You took care of your wife, like you do me?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I tried.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: You and me, we night owls. No use fightin' this shit.  Get up.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Nothin'.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Get'chu at that table up yonder.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: By myself?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: You can handle it.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: The hell is this shit?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: The fuck are all these people doin' here? Been drinkin' in this shit hole for years ain't seen this many people since I don't know...

Speaker: bojo
Dialogue: Shit hole... Hey kiss my ass, Laz.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Nigga, you go'on kiss my ass. Ya both called everybody, didn't ya?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: There you go, preacher man. Get me drunk so I don't stick my foot up yo ass.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: We ain't here to talk about that shit.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I don't know, but I been around, tell me them women shake 'em on down.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Yes, I'm goin' Georgia line. See if them women sweet like mine.

Speaker: hershel
Dialogue: You wanna cut it up, baby?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Well...

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I don't know, but I been told, them Georgia women sweet jelly roll.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Are you drunk?  Keep drinkin' water and you won't get a headache in the mornin'.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Yeah, gal I been here before.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I guess you have.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Laz? Can I sleep with you tonight?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Don't think that'd be wise.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I didn't mean it nothin' dirty.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I know you didn't. But you a grown girl. You can handle it. I got to.

Speaker: arty
Dialogue: Baby, where you goin'?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I'm gonna pee. I gotta take a break and go pee.

Speaker: arty
Dialogue: Now, this isn't fair. You said I could do it, too.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Eat shit and die, Arty. A girl can change her fuckin' mind.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: You don't gotta get up but... I gotta go...

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I think if I just piss... I'll be okay.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: You feelin' sick?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I'm just in one of my moods. You know how I get.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Yeah, I know.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I think it'd be better if you talk to me.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Just about anything, you know. It can be funny or... not. Just tell me somethin'.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Well. That's my vomit. I came in here to get sick. I thought I'd make the toilet but... anyway, I got sick.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Are you wasted?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: No. I just got a messed up stomach.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Holy shit!

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Holy shit, Ronnie!  You're a fuckin' rock star.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: I'm a what?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: All them people shoutin' your name like they were doing tonight! Shit! That arm you got'll get'chu on a box of cereal...

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Hey? You okay, Ronnie?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: I don't know what's... wrong...

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Is'okay... Is'okay...

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I feel better. Do you?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Yeah, I do.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: You... are my... sunshine.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Looks like you know a song.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Don't know where I learn't it, but... it's there in my head.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: How you feelin' today?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: You know how you feel when you come out of a bad hangover? Like your eyes can open a little bit more.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I know that.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Woke up real early. Sun was shining. Just thought I'd mess around, try to learn a song.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Go'on and sing it, I'll play.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: No, you do it. I can't sing.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Stop that foolishness. Just do as I say and close your eyes.  Close your eyes. And think about... well, for a song like this, I'd say you think about what you love.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: What I love.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Get a good picture in your mind.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Think on that. And sing wit me.  You are my sunshine. My only sunshine.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Good. I know another. It go like this.  Close your eyes Rae... sing it.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: You are my sunshine. My only sunshine. You make me happy when skies are gray.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: RONNIE!

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: RONNIE STOP! RONNIE!

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Ain't been a week and you already some nigger's whore? Gill told me. Told me how you and he... you and everybody...

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Ronnie. Please, baby...

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Did 'ya have fun with her? Sweet as a peach, I bet. Huh? Huh?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Goddamn it, I ask you a question, you better answer it, or I'm gonna blast a hole in ya!

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Ronnie...

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: YOU SHUT UP!

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Careful how you point that gun, boy.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Or what? OR WHAT?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Boy? You here to make a point, or you here to kill somebody?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Ain't gonna be callin' me boy when I blow your face off.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: You sayin' you'll do what?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: You heard me, mother-fucker. I'll fuckin' kill..

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: BOY! You so green you couldn't stomp a baby duck.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: You testing me? Huh? You testin' me, old man?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Test. Shit. What kind'a test you thinkin'? You mean like, if you a man or not? If you a killer? Only one way to prove that. You just look me in the eye, boy, and you squeeze that trigger back.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Ain't that easy, is it? I been in some scraps, son, I know. First there's that loud crack. Always louder than you think. Like it just come-up- a-cloud and clapped a mess thunder right in ya hand. BAM!

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: White light. Smell of smoke. Taste of my blood and brains in your mouth, stingin' ya eyes.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Oh, baby... just let me...

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: GODDAMMIT, RAE!

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: BOY! YOU KEEP THAT GUN POINTED AT ME!  You know she been here with me, don't cha? Been all over town, givin' up that switch you thought was your own.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: SHUT UP! SHUT UP!

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Put all your love and dreams into one woman... she turn around and give it all to another man. That's a good reason to paint the wall with me, kid. She'd fear ya then. Cuz there won't be no more question in her mind. She with a real man now. A real KILLER!

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Don't... don't say that to me...

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: ...and cowboys. So let's have it. End me or get out of my face!

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Go'on. Do it.  DO IT!

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Ronnie?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: I can't stop... I can't stop... being scared. What am I gonna do...

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I got you, baby... I got you...

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: DAMMIT LAZ PUT THE PHONE DOWN?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Thought you knew me better, gal.  I need you at my house... right now.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: I hate this town. You can't round the corner without bumping into someone who's got your number.  But... when Rae gets like she does. And she does the things that she always done. Makes me feel like she loves this place more'n me.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: All my life people called me shit like, sissy and... nervous and... I got few things in my life that make me feel like... like...

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Like a man.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Yes. I mean that's it. I wanna feel like a man with her. I wanna feel like the only man with her.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: It starts like this... fire... that spreads. Starts in my head. Then moves to my stomach. Then it goes lower. I can stop it sometimes but mostly I just jump on and ride it out... then everything'll go back to normal, you know. Only thing ever took that feeling away was... was... when I met Ronnie.  Cuz I love him so much. He's all I got in my life that's special. And I like taking care of him and helping him when he gets nervous. When I can do that for him... it's like I'm givin' somethin' of myself that I haven't givin' nobody else.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I think... I think we're fucked up. Both of us. I know I am. But... that don't mean what I feel ain't true. It don't mean I can't love. And I know, how I been is... is... REALLY BAD! So if you want to quit on me... I understand. But please... please... don't.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Hey. You wasn't at'cha work but that nosey gal up at the counter give me your home address. Hope you don't mind me comin' over.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: What do you need?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I need ya help again.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: More cough syrup?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Can I come in?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I lied to you. It was wrong. But at the time... I didn't know what to do. Imagine you got an earful from folks about that gal I's carryin'...

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: Laz... you don't need to explain yourself to me...

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Yes, I do. Cuz I feel for you. Mean to say...  I don't want you to go away. There's better ways to say what I'm trying to say, but... they it is. Don't go away.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: Laz. I'm gonna put my trust in you. I'm gonna do it knowin' all too well I can get hurt like this. And I have been hurt. Just like you.  Woman like me, I got a lot of livin' to do. But my days are precious to me. They all I got left. Don't want no more fuss. I want love in my life. You understanding me, Laz?

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I do. God's truth. I do.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: Now what'chu need me to do? Cuz I'm gonna go do it.

Speaker: tehronne
Dialogue: Yo, this here Pinetop. I think he got what you lookin' for.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: That'll do.

Speaker: tehronne
Dialogue: It got some miles on it, but my boys say she run good. Got fresh 22's on her. Ain't my doin'. That's just how it came to me. Don't worry. Nobody gonna come lookin' for it. I got the pinks... got no problem.  Ain't gonna have my girl ridin' no bus.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Don't see generosity much these days. Everything always got a catch. Guess I'm tryin' to say... thank you.

Speaker: tehronne
Dialogue: Nobody ever asks me to do shit like this for people. And you know what? I'm good at it. Naw what I mean?

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Just wanted to see.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: You know the rules.  You do know the rules, don't you?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Yeah, I know.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: Then start taking them seriously.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Yes, ma'am.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: It's okay to breathe, honey.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Yes, ma'am.

Speaker: lincoln
Dialogue: You Ronnie?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: lincoln
Dialogue: I'm Lincoln. Guess I'm gonna be your best man.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: lincoln
Dialogue: You havin' trouble with that tie? Cuz I'm pretty good at it.

Speaker: lincoln
Dialogue: Gotta do it like this or I get all turned around.

Speaker: angela
Dialogue: She's ready for you.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Now that's sharp. That's real sharp. Miss Ella Mae set you up, didn't she? You like it?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I've had nice things before but I always ruined 'em somehow.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Well, this one's yours now. You ready to take care of it?

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I want to. More'n anything. But I...

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Now... let's stop that.  You and me... we can handle this. You hear me, gal? We gonna be just fine. Now live ya life. Pull your shit together and live your life.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: I don't want you to let go.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: Maybe I won't.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: lazarus
Dialogue: You got her now?

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: I gotta pull over.

Speaker: ronnie
Dialogue: FUCK!

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: You are my sunshine. My only sunshine. You make me happy, when times are gray.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: You'll never know dear, how much I love you. Please don't take, my sunshine away.

Speaker: rae
Dialogue: See. We're okay.
